description:
/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/api/openstack$ python __init__.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
    'When True, this API service will accept admin operations.')
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/flags.py", line 215, in _wrapped
    func(*args, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/gflags.py", line 1873, in DEFINE_boolean
    DEFINE_flag(BooleanFlag(name, default, help, **args), flag_values)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/gflags.py", line 1716, in DEFINE_flag
    fv[flag.name] = flag
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/flags.py", line 131, in __setitem__
    gflags.FlagValues.__setitem__(self, name, flag)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/gflags.py", line 791, in __setitem__
    raise DuplicateFlagError(name, self)
gflags.DuplicateFlagError: The flag 'allow_admin_api' is defined twice. First from nova.api.openstack, Second from __init__.py
title: gflags.DuplicateFlagError: The flag 'allow_admin_api' is defined twice

comments.content:
/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/api/openstack$ python __init__.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "__init__.py", line 49, in <module>
    'When True, this API service will accept admin operations.')
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/flags.py", line 215, in _wrapped
    func(*args, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/gflags.py", line 1873, in DEFINE_boolean
    DEFINE_flag(BooleanFlag(name, default, help, **args), flag_values)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/gflags.py", line 1716, in DEFINE_flag
    fv[flag.name] = flag
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/flags.py", line 131, in __setitem__
    gflags.FlagValues.__setitem__(self, name, flag)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/gflags.py", line 791, in __setitem__
    raise DuplicateFlagError(name, self)
gflags.DuplicateFlagError: The flag 'allow_admin_api' is defined twice. First from nova.api.openstack, Second from __init__.py
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sgudreddi

comments.content: Could you explain if you can encounter this error in a norma use of Nova (rather than wehn calling 'python __init__.py' ?)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Closing, please reopen if you can provide the requested information.
